title: Part 5
content:
Part 5

"AH, IT'S OVER… I'm more tired than I thought."

The interviews, which started at 4 PM, had finished after meeting a total of six people, and the time had just passed 8 PM.

Kamogawa's exhaustion was understandable.

Each one of them was undoubtedly a professional in their field.

However, as people, they were too immature and nauseating.

It was a mistake to think that we could hold a proper conversation.

It'll be easy to hire everyone gathered today, but… 

"What will you do?"

"There are significant issues with their human nature, but we'll hire Ishida and Souya. We'll also be hiring Tabuchi, who I felt was the most sensible. The rest have too many issues with their inner character despite their high capabilities, so I'm not planning on hiring them this time."

"Setting aside their comments, their background and way of thinking were impressive. I can’t fully understand it, though…"

I wondered if this would help the project start running smoothly, but the uncertainty remained, and the interview didn't clear my doubts. I couldn't shake off the anxiety.

Even though they were competent, it didn't feel like anything exceptional.

Is it really possible to provide the best education with this?

"Shall we go for a meal?"

It's pointless to keep thinking about it. For now, it's best to reset and clear my mind.

"Right! Let's go all out at times like this!"

Immediately after I decided to invite Kamogawa for a meal, I took out my phone from my pocket.

"Ayanokouji-san, I think you dropped something?"

Saying so, he picked up a piece of paper from the floor and handed it to me. It was a business card.

"…Tsukishiro, huh?"

According to Naoe-sensei, he seems to be a jack-of-all-trades…

"Oh, I remember receiving it. It's all crumpled though."

"It might be good to check how useful he can be."

"Eh, are you going to contact him? He seemed like someone with a scary smile though…"

Jack-of-all-trades—it was a suspicious title, but there was no way that Naoe-sensei would keep someone useless by his side.

It might be worth trying to contact him.

I dialed the number written on the business card.

If it didn't connect, I could simply assume it wasn't meant to be.

That was how I felt.

After entering the number and hearing a few rings…

"I was expecting your call, Ayanokouji-san."

The man on the phone, presumably Tsukishiro, answered without hesitation.

"How come you knew it was me?"

I had never given my number to Tsukishiro, and this was genuinely my first time calling.

"It's only natural to do some research beforehand."

"I don't like it."

Finding out a phone number wasn't surprising.

It would be easy to find out from Naoe-sensei's secretary or someone around him. What I didn't like was his attitude. It was as if he had foreseen the call.

"What has Naoe-sensei told you?"

It didn't seem like a mere introduction. I intuitively felt there was a scheme behind it.

"I understand what you're saying, but I can't answer that here."

"You're watching to see if I mess up, aren't you?"

Just from his voice, it was impossible to sense his agitation or true intentions.

However, that could also be a dangerous judgment.

At least intuitively, I didn't think this man, Tsukishiro, would allow any weaknesses to show so easily.

"Would it be possible to meet soon? I might be able to meet your expectations."

While I was thinking, Tsukishiro offered to meet.

"Expectations?"

"Didn't you call me because you have a problem?"

"You're quite sure of yourself. I haven't even mentioned the details yet. You might regret raising my expectations too high."

"If necessary, I can come now."

Now? He seems very confident.

Or perhaps there's another motive.

I was wary of a trap, but I decided to go along with the conversation.

"Then we'll get things started now. I won't let you say it's impossible."

"Of course. What should we do then? I can come over. You're at the office at the moment, right?"

"…You bastard."

He knows I'm staying at the office?

"I think it would be smoother if I came to you. May I take about an hour of your time?"

"Do whatever you want."

Whether Tsukishiro was certain I would make contact was another issue, but there was no doubt he was investigating my surroundings and had information gathered.

This large-scale project always seemed to have information constantly circulating, with Naoe-sensei at its center.

"Um, what happened?"

"I'm meeting Tsukishiro now."

"What, right now!? What about food…?"

"You go eat alone. I'll meet him by myself."

As long as Kamogawa was partially involved in the project, he was a treasure trove of information.

Given that the other party might become an enemy, his presence could be a hindrance.

Chapter 6: Hopelessness and a Way of Life
